meanings.definition: An excessive growth or increase in size.
meanings.sent1: The garden was a mess due to the overgrowth of weeds.
meanings.sent2: The overgrowth of mold in the damp basement needed to be cleaned.
meanings.sent3: The overgrowth of laughter during the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The overgrowth of ideas in her mind blossomed into a beautiful story.
meanings.sent5: The overgrowth of vines on the old house made it look like a fairytale castle.

meanings.definition: The act or process of growing beyond normal or desired limits.
meanings.sent1: The overgrowth of the city led to traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: The overgrowth of bureaucracy in the company slowed down decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The overgrowth of excitement in the classroom made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent4: The overgrowth of responsibilities on his plate made him feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The overgrowth of technology in our lives is changing how we interact with each other.
